results.title: The Sensory world
results.creator_credit: Joel Gold, Tom Lazarus, Philip Mendlow and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”
Examines and demonstrates the empirical mechanics of human perception or misperception of our environments and the functioning - both normal and impaired - of the human senses. Uses animation to demonstrate various phenomena of the brain and illustrates its functions. Includes explanation of experiments with optic fibres and with electrical stimulation of the human brain and the memory.
Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Information processing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart, Carole Hart and Communication Research Media Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Using for its base a crowded noisy cocktail party as observed from a control booth, analyses how people process information. Pretty girls and bizarrely dressed men demonstrate attention, language processing, long and short term memory, mnemonics, retrieval strategies, and problem solving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Hart, Carole Hart and Communication Research Media Productions

results.title: Aspects of behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart and Communication Research Media Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Relating psychology to the student’s life experience this film considers ethical issues such as obedience and authority along with prejudice and attitude change. It also examines questions like: what does a social psychologist do? How does physiology relate to behaviour? Do psychologists often agree? What is cultural psychology?

results.title: Pavor nocturnus
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract narrative about dream flashbacks of a disturbing nature. A child survives a car accident in which his father was killed. He has contiinuing mental flashbacks and consequently this makes him fear death. He is bitten on the arm by a fly, and this begins a surreal experience of messages being relayed to him via the fly bites. A surreal thriller where confusion between the dream self and the real self is explored.

results.title: Kyrie
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A student called Jack is being framed by another student at his school, who accuses him of stealing his girlfriend. Jack has his exam papers forged, gets drawn into fights and is generally stalked by the jealous boyfriend. Jack cannot seem to prove his innocence and is blamed for everything by the principal of the school who doesn’t believe his stories of persecution….he later finds out why…the girl in question is the school principal’s daughter.

results.title: Soft soap
results.brief_description: Antics of Peter and Harry, two dedicated but “out of tune” artists who devote their time obsessively to recreating the characters of Harlequin and Pierrot. Designed to draw attention to the insidious ways in which advertising techniques manipulate the consumer in the market place. Shot in Melbourne. Stars Max Gillies and Joe Bolza.

results.title: Directors of the future
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A ‘mokumentary’ following the trials and tribulations of future ‘Star Director’ Izabella Dazs’ career. We begin the film as she is formulating an idea for her film and we finish by seeing her end product, “Les pommes du mal”.

results.title: Soft fruit
results.creator_credit: Christina Andreef, Helen Bowden, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: An estranged and dysfunctional family are reunited when the matriarch of the clan is diagnosed with terminal cancer. Patsy is a stoic figure, keeping the family united, despite their fractured relationships. Patsy’s eldest daughter is a nurse, caring for her ailing mother; her other two daughters travel from Sydney and abroad with their respective children. Their brother, Bo, a biker with a history of drug abuse, is out of jail on special leave and has been disowned by his disapproving father. Vic, their father, is a disgruntled, violent figure who treats his children with disdain, whilst resenting their rallying around Patsy. The narrative is devoted to reconciliation between the disparate family members, in particular the relationship between father and son. In the spirit of black and bleak comedy, Christine Andreef’s debut feature is reminiscent of early Jane Campion work, in particular “Sweetie”; indeed “Soft fruit” has many of the hallmarks of that quirky Australian comedy. Contains scenes of great poignancy and humour, despite a certain unevenness in tenor. Cast includes Jeanie Drynan, Linal Haft, Russell Dykstra, Genevieve Lemon, Sacha Horler and Alicia Talbot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Andreef, Helen Bowden, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: Sodium vapor (including Constellation and Oracle)
results.creator_credit: TV Lab at WNET/Thirteen and Bill Viola
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Writes Viola: `Sodium Vapor was recorded over a period of several weeks in the hours between one and five in the morning on the streets of an industrial area in lower Manhattan. The title derives from an interest in the particular qualities of sodium vapor street lighting — its characteristic color temperature, the shadows it casts, and the eerie quality it seems to impart to the objects it illuminates. The essence of the work is the spell which the hour has over the physical spaces of the streets in the early morning. There is always the unseen presence of the large number of people surrounding you, most of them sleeping; the camera is awake in their dreamtime. The recording of these locations in the middle of the night rather than in daylight represents a transformation — like figure/ground reversal — of these physical spaces from the familiar thoughts and activities of the day to the night time shadows of emptiness and obscurity.’
results.creator_credit_for_label: TV Lab at WNET/Thirteen and Bill Viola

results.title: Soccer heroes = Jingdu Quixia
results.creator_credit: Zhang Jichuan, Li Ling, Xie Hong and Emeishan Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Synopsis:
In the late Qing Dynasty, the European Football League champion team, The Pirates, had a match with the Foreign Ambassador team in Beijing. After the match, players of The Pirates kicked the balls to the Qing officials and the watching crowd for fun. Although insulted by The Pirates, the Qing officials dare not offend the foreigners, fearing that it may cause diplomatic trouble. A man called, Zhou Tian stood out and kicked the ball back to the captain of The Pirates, Harry, and broke the glass in his hand. The Pirates forced the Chinese to have a soccer match with them, which gave a big headache to the very incapable Qing officials. While the Qing officials were trying to catch the troublemaker, Zhou Tian, they selected a team for the match but ordered that they must not win the match. The fugitive, Zhou Tian, decided to organize a team to take Harry’s challenge. Harry’s fiancée, Jenny helped Zhou Tian and his team to escape the arrest. On the match day, the Qing government team lost to The Pirates. As everybody thought the match was over, Zhou Tian’s Dragon team appeared and defeated The Pirates. However, Zhou Tian and his team mates could not avoid being executed by the Qing government in the end.

Cultural History of the Film:
The leading actor of the film, ZHANG Fengyi is well-known in China and has starred in films such as Chen Kaige’s Farewell My Concubine (1993), John Woo’s Red Cliffs (2009) and etc. Two co-stars of the film, CHEN Peisi and JIANG Kun are two famous comedians in China.

The film was shot in 1988 when the national football team of China was placed high hope to be qualified for the FIFA World Cup finals.

Researcher’s Comments:
The film was popular at the time of its release. The film should be understood in relation to the Chinese patriotism and the Chinese Men’s Football team’s poor performance on the international stage in contrast to extremely high hope placed on the team by the Chinese people.(3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)
